attributes.action: To get the £50 administration fee for child maintenance payments abolished
attributes.background: As of January 2018 child support agencies are taking £50 in administration fees for people like myself to have payments taken from there wages on top of £100s of child support allowance that we pay. This is outrageous and many of us cannot afford this. Please help me by getting this abolished.

rejection.details:
There isn't a £50 administration fee for all child maintenance payments, so we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

A £50 fee is charged if the Child Maintenance Service has to put in place a Deductions from Earnings Order (DEO), where child maintenance is collected direct from an employer, or a Regular Deduction Order (RDO), which allows maintenance to be collected from a bank or building society account.  

Both DEOs and RDOs are enforcement measures taken by the CMS when a non-resident parent is in arrears. Alternatively, a non-resident parent can request that the CMS sets up a DEO.

You can find out more about this here:

http://researchbriefings.parliament.uk/ResearchBriefing/Summary/CBP-7777
